questions.question: Which of the following can be an external data source for a ServiceNow application?
answers: B. Data provided by a public web service using SOAP or REST

questions.question: Which one of the following is true for the Application Picker and Application Scope?
answers: A. Global is a reserved application which does not appear in the Application Picker
B. Selecting an application from the Application Picker does not set the Application Scope
C. Selecting an application from the Application Picker sets the Application Scope
D. Selecting Global in the Application Picker sets the Application Scope to Incident

comments.content: C. Selecting an application from the Application Picker sets the Application Scope
I think the answer should be A.
replies: If you sign in to a instance Global is at the top with private scopes below.

comments.content:
"Application developers must select an application as their current scope context."
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/applications/task/t_SelectAnAppFromTheAppPicker.html

questions.question: Which of the following is an available feature in Studio? (Choose two.)
answers: D. Push to external source control

comments.content: Cannot merge branch or push to an update set in studio.
Not A because you “publish” to update set.
Like the others said, C and D

You can Search Code using code search:
https://www.servicenow.com/community/developer-blog/using-code-search-to-make-developing-on-the-platform-easier/ba-p/2265789

You can also push to external source control by committing local changes.
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-application-development/page/build/applications/concept/c_SourceControlIntegration.html

questions.question: The Task table is an example of which of the following? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
My answer is A & D. There's no search result for "legacy class" and Task is (I believe) a parent class, it doesn't extend any table, so it wouldn't be a child class to anything.
"A table that extends another table is called a child class, and the table it extends is the parent class" - this is about halfway down in this link below:
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/table-administration/concept/table-extension-and-classes.html
replies: Sure. And a base class is a class that doesn't extend any other table. You can check System Definition -> Tables to see that Task doesn't extend a table. Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/table-administration/concept/table-extension-and-classes.html (search for "base class")

comments.content: Task is a parent and base table.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about deleting fields from a table?
answers: A. Table records are deleted when a field is deleted
B. User-defined non-inherited fields can be deleted
C. Any field on a table can be deleted
D. Inherited fields can be deleted

comments.content: B is the only one true.
B. User-defined non-inherited fields can be deleted

questions.question: Why would you build a custom app? (Choose two.)
answers: A. To avoid using a code repository like GitHub or GitLab
B. To replace ServiceNow base tables
C. To fulfill a specific use case on internal processes
D. To create a custom integration for a 3rd party system

comments.content: C and D are correct answers.

questions.question: What are three ServiceNow table creation methods? (Choose three.)
answers: B. Upload and turn a spreadsheet into a custom table
D. Use the Now Experience Table Creator

comments.content:
"If there are no spreadsheets or existing tables to use for your application, you can create and customize a new table." see this quote in link below:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/app-engine-studio/task/create-table.html

Also see:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/guided-app-creator/task/gac-create-table-from-scratch.html

Also, no search results if search on "Now Experience Table Creator".
Bob has a great explanation to the answer.

questions.question: When selecting a data type for a field that will be displayed on a form, which of the following statements is NOT correct?
answers: A. Use the String data type tor a free-form text field
B. Use the Phone Number data type to automate phone number data validation
C. Use the Choice data type to limit options in a field
D. Use the Date data type to enter the date and time of day

replies: There is "phone number" data type.  On form go to configure->form layout->create new field-> "data type-phone number" will be there in the available data types.

comments.content: The anwser is D only Date/Time data type allows you to choose time of day not Date.
D.  to show date AND time, you need to select date / time not just date
Exclude phone number. See the "data type" in the Application Development Fundamentals book
D) To show Date and Time, the data type Date/Time needs to be selected
Phone number exists and does validation
Phone Number data type does not exist.
D - read carefully! Date and Time, not just date.

The data type Phone Number exists and also validates the Format so B is not the correct answer. The Date data type only is there for the date and not the time. That would be the Date/Time data type field.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/reference-pages/reference/r_FieldTypes.html
For Date AND Time it would be "Date/Time". And "Phone Number" exists for sure.

questions.question: What is the GlideForm Client-side scripting object?
In a Business Rule, which one of the following returns the sys_id of the currently logged in user?

comments.content: C is the answer. g_form is client-side and the getUserID method returns the sys_ID of the currently logged in user
The gs.getUserID method is used to determine the sys_id of the currently logged-in user.

questions.question: Access Control debug information identifies whether each element of an Access Control granted or denied access. The elements appear in the debug information in the order of evaluation. In which order are the elements of an Access Control evaluated?

comments.content: Still roles first, condition and then script. all must be true to pass acl
See others info as to why.

The sequence is: Roles, Condition, Script.
That's what the annotation on the access control tab in studio says.
the blue definition in the official docs defines the order https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/contextual-security/concept/access-control-rules.html

"The sequence is ROLES first, then condition, then script." - Chuck Tomasi says so at this link: 
https://www.servicenow.com/community/grc-forum/order-of-execution-of-an-acl/m-p/1311962/highlight/true#M6538

questions.question:
Assume a table called table exists and contains 3 fields: field1, field2, field3. Examine the Access Control list for table:



Which field or fields can a user with the itil role read?

comments.content:
First - Gives Access to admin and itil for every field
second - give access to only the admin for every field
third - give read access to field 3 to itil

questions.question:
Assume a table called table exists and contains 3 fields: field1, field2, field3. Examine the Access Control list for table:



Which field or fields can a user with the itil role read?

comments.content:
First gives access to both Admin and it'll
Second gives access to field 3 only to admin.

Identify the way(s) an application can respond to an Event generated by the gs.eventQueue() method.

a. Script Action
b. Scheduled Script Execution (Scheduled Job)
c. UI Policy
d. Email Notification

comments.content:
"There are two possible ways to respond to events:
-  Email Notification
 - Script Action" - see this quote in link below:
https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/tokyo/new_to_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_automatingapps_tokyo_responding_to_events

questions.question: When troubleshooting and debugging notifications, where do you navigate to see if an email was sent m response to an event?

What are the benefits of storing the majority of an Application’s server-side script logic in a Script Include?

a. This makes execution faster.
b. Only run when called from a script.
c. The script logic can be hidden when the Application is installed from the ServiceNow Store. d. For some changes to application logic there is only one place to make edits.
answers: B. a, b, c, and d

comments.content:
Answer is C. Proof is here:
https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/tokyo/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_scripting_in_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_server_side_scripting/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_script_includes
execution performance is not based on script include but rather logic, query and when/where script is running

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a Flow Designer feature?
answers: A. Run a flow from a Catalog item
B. Call a flow from another flow or subflow
C. Add stages to a flow
D. Test a flow using the “Run as” feature

comments.content:
You can't call a flow from another flow but you can call a Subflow from a flow.  Create a Subflow and call from the main flow.

https://www.servicenow.com/community/itsm-forum/how-to-call-a-flow-from-another-flow-in-servicenow/td-p/2349397

You can:
Run a flow from a Catalog item

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/flow-designer/task/create-sc-flow.html

Add stages to a flow

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/flow-designer/task/add-stages.html

Test a flow using the "Run as" feature

https://www.servicenow.com/community/now-platform-forum/run-as-property-in-flow-designer/m-p/1142272

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/sandiego-application-development/page/administer/flow-designer/concept/flows.html
After watching the counter evidence from AnnaHr, the video clearly mentions subflows not flows. KathQ gives a clear explanation with sources, no sense to repeat it, thank you KathQ
B is incorrect because you can call flow from flow. See here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVu8mZeHImo
B. Call a flow from another flow or subflow

questions.question:
Why create Applications in ServiceNow?

a) To replace outdated, inadequate, custom business applications and processes b) To extend service delivery and management to all enterprise departments c) To allow users full access to all ServiceNow tables, records, and fields d) To extend the value of ServiceNow
answers: B. a, b, c, and d

questions.question: Flow Designer supports variable data types to store record data and complex data. Which of the following are supported variable data types? (Choose three.)
Which of the following statements is true about Guided Application Creator?
answers: A. The global scope option is turned on by default
B. Default access controls are automatically created
C. The welcome screen appears every time a new application is created
D. A scoped application user role is automatically created

comments.content:
A: You set the scope on the first screen, and choose scoped or global. It does not default to G.
B: In the Application Development Fundamentals Lab 3.2 demo, you can see that access controls are automatically created for the defined roles. B is correct.
C: "It is best practice to add at least one scoped role for the scoped application. (ADF book, ch 3.2). You have to add roles yourself, but can choose between creating new or assign existing roles.
D: The welcome screen will appear the first time the GAC is used (ADF book, ch 3.2)

questions.question: What are the ways to designate data tables when using Guided Application Creator (GAC)? (Choose three.)
answers: B. Create a new table on the platform
E. Use an existing table on the platform
F. Upload an existing word processing document

comments.content: I agree that 'Create a new table on the platform', 'Upload an existing spreadsheet'. and 'Use an existing table on the platform' are correct.

questions.question: What is the Event Registry?
answers: A. A Workflow which is launched every time an Event is generated; used to debug Events
B. The Event Log which lists all Events that have been generated
C. The method used in server side scripts to generate Events and pass parameters
D. A table containing a record for every Event known to the ServiceNow system which allows ServiceNow to react when Events are generated

comments.content: I agree that 'A table containing a record for every Event known to the ServiceNow system which allows ServiceNow to react when Events are generated' is correct.
Since event registry is a table and it contains all the lists of the events that exist in the system.

Ans -D
A table containing a record for every Event known to the ServiceNow system which allows ServiceNow to react when Events are generated: True. The Event Registry maintains a comprehensive list of recognized events. Each event corresponds to a specific occurrence or action within the system

questions.question: Identify the ways an application can respond to an Event generated by the gs.eventQueue() method: (Choose two.)

comments.content: B and D are correct answers.
B and D are correct answers.

questions.question: Is it possible to change an application’s scope?
answers: C. Yes, but only from global scope to private scope
D. Yes, but only from private scope to global scope

comments.content: Per course documentation:  It is not possible to change an application's scope once the record is saved to the database.

Yes, it is possible to change an application's scope in ServiceNow, although it's typically done by modifying the "sys_scope" field of a record through scripting or directly in the database, effectively assigning the record to a different application scope; this is not a simple UI-based change and requires careful consideration to avoid data inconsistencies.
I think the answer is B

To convert your solution from a global scoped application to a unique scope, you will need to recreate your application and move the logic over manually

So Answer is A (No)
Option A, no its not possible

questions.question: Which of the following is true about g_scratchpad? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Used to push information from the server to the client
B. Does not exist on the mobile platform
D. Has default properties passed by client-side scripts

comments.content: The g_scratchpad object has no default properties, constructors or methods. https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/washingtondc/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_scripting_in_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_server_side_scripting/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_controlling_when_business_rules_run
AB for the reasons already cited.

Answer AB: CAD book.
The g_scratchpad object does not exist on the mobile platform.

questions.question: What is required to link a ServiceNow application to a Git repository? (Choose three.)

comments.content: From the CAD book: Configure the link: repository URL, user name, and password.

A,D&E
Remember that options B (ACL), C (Application name), and F (URL) are not directly related to linking a ServiceNow application to a Git repository. Instead, focus on the URI, user name, and authentication credentials for successful integration.
Password, Username, URL - DEF is correct
Repository URL, user name and password

questions.question: What data types of Flow Variables are supported to store record data? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
In ServiceNow Flow Designer, Flow Variables can store various data types, including record data. Of the options given, the three supported data types that can be used to store record data are:
	- Array (array)
	- Integer (integer)
	- String (string)
These types are available when creating flow variables and allow you to store and pass values between steps within a flow
